content.question:
“In somnis, ecce, ante oculos maestissimus Hector

visus adesse mihi largosque effundere fletus,

raptatus bigis ut quondam, aterque cruento

pulvere perque pedes traiectus lora tumentes.

Ei mihi, qualis erat, quantum mutatus ab illo

Hectore qui redit exuvias indutus Achilli

vel Danaum Phrygios iaculatus puppibus ignes.”

Aeneid 2.270-276

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. Identify the speaker of the passage.

2. (A) Translate in context largos effundere fletus (line 2) and (B) identify the case of fletus.

3. Translate in context ut (line 3).

4. Write out line 4 (pulvere . . . tumentes) and mark the scansion.

5. In Greek myth, whom did Hector slay to get the armor (exuvias, line 6) of Achilles?

6. What action does the speaker attribute to Hector in line 7 (vel . . . ignes) ?
